questions.question_text:
You are developing a Microsoft Teams app that will have a personal tab. The personal tab requires single sign-on (SSO) authentication to the Microsoft identity platform. The app will be published to Microsoft AppSource.
What do you require to implement SSO for the app?

choices.A: an Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) application that has device code flow
choices.C: a single-tenant Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) application
choices.B: a multi-tenant Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) application

questions.answer_description:
Microsoft Teams provides single sign-on function for application to obtain signed-in Teams user token to access Microsoft Graph and other APIs. Teams Toolkit facilitates the interaction by abstracting some of the Azure AD flows and integrations behind some simple APIs. This enables you to add single sign-on (SSO) features easily to your Teams application.
For applications that interact with the user in a chat, a Team, or a channel, SSO manifests as an Adaptive Card, which the user can interact with to invoke the
Azure AD consent flow.
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/toolkit/add-single-sign-on?tabs=typescript

comments.content:
I think A is correct, 
the link just say that if the app is multitenant the user must give consent, if i got it right..?

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT
-

You need to build a Microsoft Teams tab that will use the Microsoft Teams JavaScript client SDK to perform actions in the tab.

How should you complete the code? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

questions.answer_description:
In the app manifest for your Microsoft Teams app you'll define a single messaging extension with up to ten different commands. Each command defines a type
(action or search), and the locations in the client it can be invoked from (compose message area, command bar, and/or message).
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/platform/messaging-extensions/what-are-messaging-extensions

choices.C: by using the Manage teams option for a team
choices.B: from the compose box of a Teams chat
choices.D: by using the Add a tab option in the Teams channel

discussion.content: from the Teams sidebar menu is underlined

questions.question_text:
This question requires that you evaluate the underlined text to determine if it is correct.
You develop a Microsoft Teams application that uses a messaging extension.
Users can invoke the messaging extension from the Teams sidebar menu.
Instructions: Review the underlined text. If it makes the statement correct, select `No change is needed`. If the statement is incorrect, select the answer choice that makes the statement correct.

choices.B: a bot, a link in a tab, or a deep link only
choices.D: a link in a tab, a deep link, or an activity feed only
choices.C: a link in a tab, a webhook, or a connector only
choices.A: a connector, a webhook, or a bot only
